definition: actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party

sentences.english: People often use several well-known excuses to procrastinate.
sentences.chinese: 人們經常用一些人所共知的藉口去拖延時間。

sentences.english: What happened next is famous in the history of biology.
sentences.chinese: 接下來發生的在生物學史上人所共知。

sentences.english: The association between pollinators and showy flowers is well known.
sentences.chinese: 蟲媒和豔麗花朵的關係人所共知。

sentences.english: Mr. Brown is known as a free loader.
sentences.chinese: 布朗先生是個人所共知的喜歡揩油的人。

sentences.english: China's consumer-spending data are notoriously murky.
sentences.chinese: 中國的居民消費支出數據統計有出入，這人所共知。

sentences.english: Mountain weather is notoriously difficult to predict.
sentences.chinese: 山地氣候難以預料是人所共知的。

definition: known by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
see 盡人皆知|尽人皆知[jin4 ren2 jie1 zhi1]
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
irreproachable (idiom)/nothing blameworthy about it at all
from this, it can be seen that...
to make reference to/to write about
